Rule.Name: sMapiEnabledFalse
Rule.Title: Outlook will not be able to connect to the mailbox of '%USERDISPLAYNAME%'
Rule.Text: The MAPI protocol is disabled for the mailbox of user '%USERDISPLAYNAME%', so Outlook will not be able to connect to the user's mailbox. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on configuring the MapiEnabled attribute for this user.

Rule.Name: sUserMbxWithMasterAcctSid
Rule.Query: count(../Instance[(Setting[@Key1='msExchRecipientTypeDetails' and Value=1] or Setting[@Key1='msExchRecipientTypeDetails' and Value=2147483648]) and Setting[@Key1='msExchMasterAccountSid' and string-length(Value)>0]])>0
Rule.Title: Exchange connection issues because the account for '%USERDISPLAYNAME%' has the msExchMasterAccountSid attribute configured
Rule.Text: Exchange connection issues will occur because '%USERDISPLAYNAME%' has a 'User' mailbox and they also have the msExchMasterAccountSid attribute configured for their account. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on how to remove the msExchMasterAccountSid attribute for the Active Directory account of '%USERDISPLAYNAME%'.

Rule.Name: sUserAccountInAutomapList
Rule.Title: The account for '%USERDISPLAYNAME%' is listed in the msExchangeDelegateListLink attribute
Rule.Text: In some scenarios this causes problems with reminders, search, and sending email in Outlook. Please run the 'Test E-mail AutoConfiguration' tool and check the AlternativeMailbox section of the Autodiscover results to ensure the mailbox for '%USERDISPLAYNAME%' is not listed as a 'Delegate' mailbox.

Rule.Name: sDefaultProfileRegMissing15plus
Rule.Title: Incomplete Outlook scan due to missing registry data
Rule.Text: Your Outlook scan is incomplete. This is because you do not have a default profile specified for the DefaultProfile value under the 'HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook' registry key.
Rule.Symptoms: A failure occurred in the Outlook scan

Rule.Name: sDefaultProfileRegMissingPre15
Rule.Title: Incomplete Outlook scan due to missing registry data
Rule.Text: Your Outlook scan is incomplete. This is because you do not have a default profile specified for the DefaultProfile value under the 'HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows Messaging Subsystem\Profiles' registry key.
Rule.Symptoms: A failure occurred in the Outlook scan

Rule.Name: sOutlookPR
Rule.Title: The build number for Outlook.exe indicates a Private Release (PR) build. This is an unsupported configuration.
Rule.Text: The build number for Outlook.exe '{0}' indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use. Please unininstall the hotfix related to this build number. Then, click the 'Click here ...' link and install the latest update listed in the referenced article.

Rule.Name: sOutlook16Scanned

Rule.Name: sPSTNullFreeOnClosePol

Rule.Text: PSTNullFreeOnClose=1 under the \Policies hive in the registry. This can cause Outlook to take longer than expected to exit and and Outlook.exe may remain running in the background. See your Administrator to change this policy.

Rule.Name: ClosestGCOnEx14Plus
Rule.Title: Closest GC: Cause found for address book, delegation, multiple mailbox access and archive mailbox issues.
Rule.Text: Your mailbox is on Exchange 2010 (or later) and the 'Closest GC' registry value is not supported. In this environment, the CAS server is your Global Catalog. Here are things that can break if you do not go through the CAS for directory access: delegate / multiple mailbox access for older Outlook clients (2003), support for archive mailbox.
Rule.Symptoms: Address Book,Delegation,Archive email,Configuration (unsupported or problematic),Error message

Rule.Name: ClosestGCOnEx0307
Rule.Title: Closest GC = 1 in the registry. This can affect which Global Catalog server is used by Outlook.
Rule.Text: The 'Closest GC' registry value =1. This can cause Outlook to use a different Global Catalog server than it would without this registry configuration. If you are having issues with address book, delegation and authentication functionality in Outlook, see if the problems continue without this registry data.

Rule.Name: DSServerOnEx14Plus
Rule.Title: DS Server: Cause found for address book, delegation, multiple mailbox access and archive mailbox issues.
Rule.Text: Your mailbox is on Exchange 2010 (or later) and the 'DS SERVER' registry value is not supported. In this environment the CAS server is your Global Catalog. Here are things that can break if you do not go through the CAS for directory access: delegate / multiple mailbox access for older Outlook clients (2003), support for archive mailbox.
Rule.Symptoms: Address Book,Delegation,Archive email,Configuration (unsupported or problematic),Error message

Rule.Name: DSServerOnEx0307
Rule.Title: DS Server = '%DSSERVER%' in the registry. This can affect which Global Catalog server is used by Outlook.
Rule.Text: DS Server = '%DSSERVER%' in the registry. This can cause Outlook to use a different Global Catalog server than it would without this registry configuration. If you are having issues with address book, delegation and authentication functionality in Outlook, see if the problems continue without this registry data.

Rule.Text: The Offline Address Book (OAB) is using an address book other than the default Global Address List. If this is not correct, please re-download the OAB using the Global Address List.

Rule.Name: dtOABLastModifTime15AndAbove
Rule.Title: OAB last update date and time
Rule.Text: The OAB was last updated on {0}.

Rule.Name: sOABDownloadBITS15AndAbove
Rule.Title: The address book information for your organization is probably out of date in Outlook
Rule.Text: The address list for your organization may not contain recent changes or additions because the Offline Address Book (OAB) files on your computer haven't been updated by Outlook in the last {0} days.

Rule.Name: sOABDownloadFailedMapiHttpX86
Rule.Query: $sOABDownloadBITS15AndAbove and $n2DigitVersion=15 and $bitness='x86' and $fMapiHttpConnected and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4659.1000')=0 and not($sExSrvNameCloud)
Rule.Title: The Offline Address Book (OAB) fails to successfully update
Rule.Text: Your configuration indicates a known issue where the Offline Address Book (OAB) fails to update after installing the Outlook update from KB article 2986204 or 2889951. To fix this issue, click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the 32-bit (x86) update listed in the article.

Rule.Name: sOABDownloadFailedMapiHttpX64
Rule.Query: $sOABDownloadBITS15AndAbove and $n2DigitVersion=15 and $bitness='x64' and $fMapiHttpConnected and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4659.1000')=0 and not($sExSrvNameCloud)
Rule.Title: The Offline Address Book (OAB) fails to successfully update
Rule.Text: Your configuration indicates a known issue where the Offline Address Book (OAB) fails to update after installing the Outlook update from KB article 2986204 or 2889951. To fix this issue, click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the 64-bit (x64) update listed in the article.

Rule.Name: sOABnotUsingGAL15
Rule.Title: The Offline Address Book is not using the Global Address List
Rule.Text: The Offline Address Book (OAB) is using an address book other than the default Global Address List. If this is not correct, please re-download the OAB using the Global Address List.

Rule.Name: sAutomappingDuplicateSelfStore
Rule.Title: Reminders don't fire, email messages stay in the Outbox, the To-Do Bar displays an error or Search indexing frequently restarts.
Rule.Text: Your own mailbox is listed as a 'Delegate' mailbox in the Autodiscover information from your Exchange server. In this configuration, you will experience numerous problems in Outlook. If you have already configured Full Access permissions per KB article 2548313, make sure to also check the msExchDelegateListLink attribute for your account in Active Directory or the Configuration Details for this scan. Click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on fixing this problem.

Rule.Title: Your archive mailbox is not accessible
Rule.Text: Your archive mailbox is not accessible because you have build 15.0.4641.1001 of Outlook 2013 installed. This build is from the August 2014 update. Click the 'Click here...' link below for steps to resolve this issue.

The attempt to log on to Microsoft Exchange has failed.' when accessing additional mailboxes. Please install the latest build of Outlook 2010 to resolve this issue.

Rule.Name: DelegateWastebasketStyle
Rule.Title: Delegate receives an error deleting a meeting from a manager's calendar
Rule.Text:
DelegateWastebasketStyle=4 in the registry. In this configuration, a delegate will receive the following error message if they do not have at least Author permission to the Deleted Items folder in the owner's mailbox:
'Some items cannot be deleted. They were either moved or already deleted, or access was denied.'

Rule.Name: sDelegateSentItemsStyle
Rule.Title: Email messages will stay in the Outbox folder because DelegateSentItemsStyle=1 in the registry
Rule.Text: DelegateSentItemsStyle=1 in the registry, and your profile is in Online mode with Microsoft Exchange. In this configuration, email messages will remain in the Outbox if you send the messages from a shared mailbox.

Rule.Name: sDelegateSentItemsStylePol
Rule.Title: DelegateSentItemsStyle=1 using group policy
Rule.Text: The DelegateSentItemsStyle value is set to 1 via group policy and your profile is in Online mode. This combination of settings is not supported. Please check with your administrator to discuss changing your profile or this policy.

Rule.Name: sDisableResponseButtons
Rule.Title: Meeting invite response buttons disabled
Rule.Text: Manager is unable to accept or decline meetings because DisableResponseButtons=1

Rule.Name: sMissingPR_PROFILE_HOME_SERVER_ADDRS
Rule.Title: Outlook profile is missing a property related to adding additional Exchange mailboxes
Rule.Text: The 101e6613 property value is missing from your profile. You will not be able to manually add additional Exchange mailboxes to your profile.

Please click the 'Click here...' link below if you need additional information before deleting these messages.

Rule.Text: Junk e-mail messages are being permanently deleted because of your Junk E-mail settings are configured to delete all e-mail considered as Junk.

Rule.Name: sJunkEmailFeatureDisabled
Rule.Title: The Junk E-mail feature is disabled by policy
Rule.Text: The Junk E-mail feature is disabled in the registry by the DisableAntiSpam group policy setting. In this configuration, you will not be able to configure Junk E-mail settings and the junk e-mail filter in Outlook will not process e-mail messages.

Rule.Name: sOutlookEnableSpoofyEmails
Rule.Title: The OutlookEnableSpoofyEmails value is set to 1 as a policy in the registry
Rule.Text: When OutlookEnableSpoofyEmails=1 as a policy in the registry and your Outlook profile is in Online mode, your client may cause the transaction logs to grow on the Exchange server.

Rule.Name: sSCLIgnoredOL14E15
Rule.Query: not($fAuthServiceProblemValuePol) and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'14.0.7116.5000')<0 and (($fEXCHAuthPackage='Anonymous') or ($fEXCHAuthPackage=false() and $sEncryptionOff14O=1)) and starts-with($sExVersion,'15.') and $fDisableAntiSpam!=1 and not($sJunkThresholdNone=1)
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder for a mailbox on Exchange 2013 (or Office 365)
Rule.Text: Your mailbox is either on Office 365 or an on-premise Exchange 2013 server and Anonymous authentication is configured in your Outlook profile. You also have Junk E-mail settings at something other than 'off'. In this configuration, some email may unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder.

Rule.Name: sSCLIgnoredOL15E15
Rule.Query: not($fAuthServiceProblemValuePol) and versioncompare($sFullAppVersion,'15.0.4605.1000')<0 and (($fEXCHAuthPackage='Anonymous') or ($fEXCHAuthPackage=false() and $sEncryptionOff15andAboveO=1)) and starts-with($sExVersion,'15.') and $fDisableAntiSpam!=1 and not($sJunkThresholdNone=1)
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder for a mailbox on Exchange 2013 (or Office 365)
Rule.Text: Your mailbox is either on Office 365 or an on-premise Exchange 2013 server and Anonymous authentication is configured in your Outlook profile. You also have Junk E-mail settings at something other than 'off'. In this configuration, some email may unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder.

Rule.Name: sSCLIgnoredOL12E15
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder for a mailbox
Rule.Text: Your mailbox is on Exchange Server 2013 and you also have Junk E-mail settings at something other than 'off'. In this configuration, some email may unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder.

Rule.Name: sSCLIgnoredLTEx15NoEncrypt
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=12 and number(substring($sExVersion,1,2))<=14 and $sEncryptionOff12O and $fDisableAntiSpam!=1 and not($sJunkThresholdNone=1)
Rule.Title: Messages unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder for a mailbox
Rule.Text: Your Outlook profile for Exchange Server does not have Encryption enabled and you also have Junk E-mail settings at something other than 'off'. In this configuration, some email may unexpectedly go to the Junk E-mail folder.

Rule.Name: sRemindersDisabled
Rule.Title: Reminders are disabled
Rule.Text: Reminders are disabled. If reminders are not being managed by group policy, you can re-enable them through Advanced settings in the Outlook Options dialog box.

Setting.Key2: Automatically accept meeting requests and process cancellations

Rule.Name: sRoomFinderWow
Rule.Query: not($bitness=$sWindowsBitness) and $n2DigitVersion>12 and (($nRoomFinderShow=0 and $nPoliciesRoomFinderShow=-1) or $nPoliciesRoomFinderShow=0 or not($nUmOutlookAddinWowLoadBehavior=3))
Rule.Title: Room Finder will be hidden on the Appointment tab in a meeting invite
Rule.Text: If either RoomFinderShow=0 or the UMOutlookAddin add-in is not loaded, the Room Finder will not appear in a meeting invite. On your machine, RoomFinderShow = {0} in the registry, and the UmOutlookAddin LoadBehavior={1} (anything other than LoadBehavior=3 means it is not loaded on launch).

Rule.Name: sRoomFinder
Rule.Query: ($bitness=$sWindowsBitness) and $n2DigitVersion>12 and (($nRoomFinderShow=0 and $nPoliciesRoomFinderShow=-1 ) or $nPoliciesRoomFinderShow=0 or not($nUmOutlookAddinLoadBehavior=3))
Rule.Title: Room Finder will be hidden on the Appointment tab in a meeting invite
Rule.Text: If either RoomFinderShow=0 or the UMOutlookAddin add-in is not loaded, the Room Finder will not appear in a meeting invite. On your machine, RoomFinderShow = {0} in the registry, and the UmOutlookAddin LoadBehavior={1} (anything other than LoadBehavior=3 means it is not loaded on launch).

Rule.Text: AutomateProcessing = None. In this configuration, the Exchange Calendar Assistant is not automatically processing meeting requests for this mailbox. This is not the default configuration.

Rule.Name: sAutomateProcessingAutoUpdate

Rule.Text: AutomateProcessing = AutoUpdate.

Rule.Text: The AutomateProcessing parameter cannot be set to AutoAccept for User mailboxes. If this is a User mailbox, please change the AutomateProcessing parameter to AutoUpdate.

Rule.Name: scalAssistAddNewItemsInfo

Rule.Text: Calendar Assistant is configured to add new meetings tentatively to the Calendar

Rule.Name: scalAssistAddNewItemsWarning
Rule.Title: Calendar Assistant is not configured to add new meetings tentatively to the Calendar
Rule.Text: The configuration of the Exchange Calendar Assistant for your mailbox has the AddNewRequestsTentatively parameter set to False. Therefore, new meetings will not be added tentatively to your calendar unless Outlook is running.

Rule.Name: sFreeBusy
Rule.Title: Free/Busy Publish Range
Rule.Text: Policy Setting = {0} months. User setting (lowest priority)={2} months. Availability Options: piFBPublishRange = {3} months, piFBUserPublishRange= {1} months.

Rule.Name: sFBZeroPolPubRange
Rule.Title: Free/Busy Publish Range is set to 0 months by policy
Rule.Text: Free/Busy Publish Range is set to 0 months by policy. Other users will be unable to see your free/busy information if they are not using the Exchange 2007/2010 Availability Service to retrieve free/busy information.

Rule.Name: spiFBPublishRangeBug
Rule.Title: Free/busy information may not include the correct number of months
Rule.Text: The Free/busy range setting in your mailbox does not match the free/busy publishing range specified by group policy. This issue was fixed by the update in KB article 2596485. To correct this problem, please install the latest cumulative update for Outlook 2010.

Rule.Name: sFBZeroAvailOptionPubRange
Rule.Title: Free/Busy Publish Range is set to 0 months
Rule.Text: Free/Busy Publish Range is set to 0 months in your availability options. Other Users won't be able to see your free/busy information.

Rule.Name: sFBZeroUserPubRange
Rule.Title: Free/Busy Publish Range is set to 0 months in Outlook
Rule.Text: Free/Busy Publish Range is set to 0 months in the Options dialog box. Other users will be unable to see your free/busy information if they are not using the Exchange 2007/2010 Availability Service to retrieve free/busy information.

Rule.Name: UselegacyFB1

Rule.Text: The EnableDirectBooking value is set to 1 in the registry. Direct booking was deprecated in Outlook 2013, so this registry value will not be used by Outlook.

Rule.Name: sIgnoredConversationsCount
Rule.Title: Messages in some email conversations are being ignored (deleted) or automatically moved

Rule.Name: sNullNNC
Rule.Title: The nickname cache may be corrupted
Rule.Text: The property in your mailbox that contains the nickname cache (autocomplete feature) may be corrupted as it has a value of NULL.

Rule.Name: sNNCWarning
Rule.Title: Email addresses for some people may not auto-complete because you have not recently sent them email
Rule.Text: The auto-complete (nickname) cache has a pre-defined total number of entries it can contain: {0}. The number of items in your cache, {1}, exceeds 90 percent of this limit. When you reach the limit, Outlook will start removing the oldest entries from the cache. These will be the entries for the people you have not recently emailed.

Rule.Name: sMissingNNC
Rule.Title: The nickname cache is missing
Rule.Text: The nickname cache is missing from your mailbox and the "Automatic name checking" option is enabled. This is a rare situation as the cache will be populated shortly after you resolve any email address.

Rule.Name: sNicknameLongTermSaveDelay
Rule.Title: NicknameLongTermSaveDelay value in the registry is too high or too low
Rule.Text: NicknameLongTermSaveDelay = {0} in the registry and the default value is 600000. A setting above the default can cause delays in nickname cache updates and a setting below the default may impact performance on your Exchange server.

Rule.Name: sUMEnabledUser
Rule.Text: User is UM Enabled

Rule.Name: sManageVoiceMailMissing
Rule.Title: The 'Manage Voice Mail' control is missing from the File tab (backstage) in Outlook
Rule.Text: You are 'voice mail enabled' and you are connecting to your Exchange mailbox using MAPI/HTTP. But, the 'Microsoft Exchange Add-in' is out of date. In this configuration, the 'Manage Voice Mail' control is not displayed on the File tab (also known as the backstage) in Outlook. Click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the latest update for the add-in (Outexum-x-none.msp).

Rule.Name: sKB2837618InstalledE2007Offline
Rule.Title: Potential issues because KB2837618 (November 2013 security update) is installed
Rule.Text: You may experience crashes, free/busy, or Out of Office issues because the update from KB2837618 is installed and your mailbox is on Exchange 2007. Please click the 'Click here ...' link for additional details.
Rule.Symptoms: Crash, Free Busy,Out of Office (OOF),IMAP,Error message

Rule.Name: sKB2825677InstalledE2007Offline
Rule.Title: Potential issues because KB2825677 (October 2013 cumulative update) is installed
Rule.Text: You may experience crashes, free/busy, or Out of Office issues because the update from KB2825677 is installed and your mailbox is on Exchange 2007. Please click the 'Click here ...' link for additional details.
Rule.Symptoms: Crash, Free Busy,Out of Office (OOF),IMAP,Error message

Object.Name: Microsoft and third-party modules loaded into the Outlook process
Object.LogText: Collecting Add-ins(Microsoft and third-party) and third-party modules

Rule.Name: sAddinInfo
Rule.Text: Description ={4}. Company= {1}. Version= {2}. Path= {3}.

Rule.Name: sOutlookChangeNotifierAddIn
Rule.Title: {1} (version {0})
Rule.Text: Outlook does not close after you install iTunes. When you try to exit or close Microsoft Office Outlook 2010 or Microsoft Office Outlook 2007, the process does not end as expected or it seems to take a long time to complete.

Rule.Name: fAplzod32DllCountGT1
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Object/Instance[Setting[@Key1='DllName' and lower-case(Value)='aplzod32.dll'] and Setting[@Key1='Version' and Value='4.2.26.0']])>0

Rule.Name: sVerifaceImagereogDllFound
Rule.Title: Installed third-party software may cause Outlook to stay at the 'Looking for credentials' dialog box
Rule.Text:
The VeriFace software product has Imagereog.dll loaded in the Outlook.exe process. Under some conditions this software has been seen to prevent Outlook from connecting to your Exchange mailbox.
If Outlook does not get past the 'Looking for credentials' dialog box, click the 'Click here ...' link below to see a possible solution.

Rule.Name: sAppSensePvcDllAndCitrixFound
Rule.Title: AppSense software installed in a Citrix environment
Rule.Text:
The AppSense virtualization software has a file called Pvc.dll loaded in the Outlook.exe process. The version you have has been known to cause Outlook to stop responding in a Citrix environment.
Please consider updating the AppSense software if Outlook is not stable.

Rule.Name: sAppSenseLockDownMgrDllAndCitrixFound
Rule.Title: AppSense software installed in a Citrix environment
Rule.Text:
The AppSense virtualization software has a file called LockDownMgr.dll loaded in the Outlook.exe process. The version you have has been known to cause Outlook to stop responding in a Citrix environment.
Please consider updating the AppSense software if Outlook is not stable.

Rule.Name: sDMOLHelperDll531xFound
Rule.Title: DmOLHelper.dll (version 5.3.1.x) is loaded under Outlook (possible stability issue)
Rule.Text: The DMOLHelper.dll file is loaded in the Outlook.exe process. Certain versions (5.3.1.x) of this file have been known to cause Outlook to stop responding or crash. Please consider updating your Open Text software if Outlook is not stable.

Rule.Name: sThirdPartyModuleIssuesNotFound
Rule.Title: None found
Rule.Text: None found

Rule.Name: siCloudAddinDetected
Rule.Title: Email messages may stay in the Outbox when 'iCloud Outlook Addin' (version 4.2.26.0) is enabled
Rule.Text: The 'iCloud Outlook Addin' add-in (APLZOD32.dll version 4.2.26.0) is installed on your computer. This version has been known to cause email messages to stay in the Outbox folder (unsent). If you have problems with email not getting sent, try disabling the 'iCloud Outlook Addin'.

Rule.Name: siCloudAddinDetectedWow
Rule.Title: Email messages may stay in the Outbox when 'iCloud Outlook Addin' (version 4.2.26.0) is enabled
Rule.Text: The 'iCloud Outlook Addin' add-in (APLZOD32.dll version 4.2.26.0) is installed on your computer. This version has been known to cause email messages to stay in the Outbox folder (unsent). If you have problems with email not getting sent, try disabling the 'iCloud Outlook Addin'.

Rule.Name: sAllowShutdownWithExternalReferences
Rule.Title: AllowShutdownWithExternalReferences is set
Rule.Text: The AllowShutdownWithExternalReferences registry value is set and you could experience slower shutdowns of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sDisableFastShutdown
Rule.Title: Fast shutdown is disabled by the DisableFastShutdown registry value
Rule.Text: The DisableFastShutdown registry value is set and you could experience slower shutdowns of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sFastShutdownBehavior
Rule.Title: Fast shutdown behavior may be disabled by registry data
Rule.Text: The FastShutdownBehavior registry value is not 0 (default value). With this configuration, you could experience slower shutdowns of Outlook. For more information please read http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd941316.aspx

Rule.Name: sFastShutdownBehaviorPol
Rule.Title: Fast shutdown behavior may be disabled by group policy
Rule.Text: The FastShutdownBehavior group policy value is set in the registry to a non-zero value. With this configuration, you could experience slower shutdowns of Outlook. For more information please read http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd941316.aspx

Rule.Name: sAddinFastShutdownBehavior
Rule.Title: AddinFastShutdownBehavior is set
Rule.Text: The AddinFastShutdownBehavior registry value is set and you could experience slower shutdowns of Outlook. For more information please read http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee720183.aspx

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerOutlook
Rule.Title: An incompatible version of the PDFMaker add-in is installed
Rule.Text: You have a version of the PDFMaker add-in installed that is not compatible with Outlook. Please update the add-in to version 10 or higher. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sPDFMakerx64
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion>13 and ((substring($.,1,2)='10' and number(substring($.,4,1))<1) or substring($.,1,1)!='1') and $bitness='x64'
Rule.Title: Adobe PDFMaker detected on a client with 64-bit Office
Rule.Text: The Adobe PDFMaker add-in was found on a computer that also has a 64-bit install of Office. The PDFMaker add-in version you have is not supported with 64-bit versions of Office. http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/compatible-web-browsers-pdfmaker-applications.html

Rule.Name: sHKCURequireShutdownNotification
Rule.Title: RequireShutdownNotification is set for add-in '{0}' under HKEY_CURRENT_USER
Rule.Text: RequireShutdownNotification is set for the {0} add-in under the HKEY_CURRENT_USER hive in the registry. This may cause slower shutdowns of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sDisabledAddins
Rule.Title: Add-ins have been automatically disabled because of performance or stability issues
Rule.Text: Outlook add-ins have been disabled due to performance or stability issues. To see the list of disabled add-ins, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'Disabled Add-ins' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sUserReenabledAddins
Rule.Title: Problematic add-in(s) re-enabled by the user
Rule.Text: {0} add-in(s) disabled by Outlook because of performance or stability issues was/were re-enabled by the user. To see the list of disabled add-ins that were re-enabled by the user, click the Configuration Details tile (above) and then search for 'DoNotDisableAddinList' using the Find feature.

Rule.Name: sEmptyRestrictedAddinList
Rule.Title: No add-ins are loaded in Outlook due to group policy settings.
Rule.Text: Under the Policies hive, RestrictToList=1 but there are no add-ins listed under the AddinList key. Therefore, no add-ins are being loaded by Outlook. Please make sure this is a desired configuration.

Rule.Name: sDisableAddinLogging
Rule.Title: Add-in logging is not enabled
Rule.Text: Performance logging of add-ins is not enabled. This configuration will limit your ability to troubleshoot problems with add-ins.

Rule.Name: sBadDpofeedb
Rule.Title: Possible crashing issue due to third party file Dpofeedb.dll
Rule.Text: Outlook may crash when you work with shared calendars if a third-party add-in installs certain versions of Dpofeedb.dll

Rule.Text: The 'Boot' key was found in the registry under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Outlook\AutoDiscover\Boot. This configuration can cause the failure of Autodiscover and Outlook features such as free/busy, OAB, and MailTips that use Autodiscover.

Rule.Name: sWrongRegTypeNoOST

Rule.Text: UseWindowsUserCredentials = 1 in the registry. This configuration has been known to cause Autodiscover and profile creation to fail if your mailbox is in Office 365. You can ignore this warning if your mailbox is not in Office 365.

Rule.Title: Linked images may not be displayed for the email recipient
Rule.Text: Because 'Send Pictures with Document' is set to 0 in the registry, recipients of email you send may see a red X instead of some images because the image was not included in the email message.

Rule.Name: sSaveSent

The value 'SaveSent' = 0 is configured as a {0} setting. This configuration causes email messages to not get saved in the Sent Items folder.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on the registry path for the 'SaveSent' value. Then, update the {0} setting for this value.

Rule.Name: sEnableRememberPWD

Rule.Title: Unexpected prompt for password with Exchange mailbox because EnableRememberPWD = 0 as a {0} value in the registry
Rule.Text:
The value ' EnableRememberPwd ' = 0 is configured as a {0} value in the registry. This configuration can cause an unexpected prompt for credentials with an Exchange mailbox and/or online archive. To update this value, {1}.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on the registry path for the ' EnableRememberPWD ' value.

Rule.Name: sAuthenticationService

Rule.Text:
The value of AuthenticationService is either 9, 10, or 16 and is configured as a {0} value in the registry. If you have an Office 365 mailbox, this configuration can cause an unexpected prompt for credentials. To update this value, {1}.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on the registry path for the 'AuthenticationService' value.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOff

Rule.Text: The VBAOff value in the HKCU registry hive is set to a value other than 0. In this configuration, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is disabled in Office programs. Set VBAOff=0 if you need to use VBA.

Rule.Name: sUseOnlineContentOff

Rule.Text: The weather feature is disabled in Outlook because the 'Allow Office to connect to the Internet' option is not enabled in the Trust Center.

Rule.Name: sLatinFontSettingBlankOL

Rule.Text: The text in email messages you receive may contain characters that are unreadable. This problem occurs when the 'Latin' string value under {0} is blank. Click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sWordOptionsAssistFound

Rule.Text: The registry contains the following subkey: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\15.0\Word\Options\Assist. When the registry contains this subkey, Outlook cannot preview a Word document. Click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sOLK14PlusLync15SearchX86

Rule.Text: When you use the Search functionality in Windows you are unable to open Outlook items returned in your search results. This occurs because you have Outlook 2010 plus Lync 2013 installed. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for the resolution.

Rule.Title: Possible performance issues due to TerminalServerSpellingStart policy
Rule.Text: Outlook may experience peformance problems or cause high CPU because the TerminalServerSpellingStart policy value is set too high. The default value is 5000 (decimal). Please consider lowering the value specified for the policy.

Rule.Name: sHkcuVBAOffPol

Rule.Name: sMarkInternalAsUnsafe
Rule.Title: Office Documents will open only in Protected View

Rule.Name: sMarkInternalAsUnsafePol
Rule.Title: Office Documents will open only in Protected View
Rule.Text: The MarkInternalAsUnsafe registry value is set to 1 through group policy, and Office document attachments from internal senders will open in Protected View. Please see your administrator if you need to change this policy.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode is not set
Rule.Text: Outlook Default Security - This option is the default configuration in Outlook. Users can configure security themselves, and Outlook ignores any attachment or programmatic access security settings configured in Group Policy.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode0
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 0
Rule.Text: Outlook Default Security - This option is the default configuration in Outlook. Users can configure security themselves, and Outlook ignores any attachment or programmatic access security settings configured in Group Policy.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode1
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 1
Rule.Text: Use Security Form from 'Outlook Security Settings' Public Folder - Outlook uses the settings from the security form published in the designated public folder.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode2
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 2
Rule.Text: Use Security Form from 'Outlook 10 Security Settings' Public Folder - Outlook uses the settings from the security form published in the designated public folder.

Rule.Name: AdminSecurityMode3
Rule.Title: AdminSecurityMode = 3
Rule.Text: Use Outlook Security Group Policy - Outlook uses security settings from Group Policy.

Rule.Name: CheckAdminSettings
Rule.Title: CheckAdminSettings = {0}
Rule.Text: The CheckAdminSettings registry value is not used by Outlook 2007 and above.

Rule.Name: sOrphans

Rule.Text: There is(are) {0} file(s) in the Outlook Secure Temp Folder '%OLKSECTMPFOLDER%'. See the OutlookSecureTempFolder node in Configuration Details for the list of files.

Object.Name: Application Event Log Entries for Full OAB Downloads
Object.LogText: Collecting Application Event Log Entries for Full OAB Downloads

Object.Name: Partial event data for full OAB download
You do not have any Offline Address Book files on your computer, or the Offline Address Book files could not be opened for some other reason.
You forced a full .oab file download manually.
The name of the Offline Address Book could not be obtained on the client. This behavior occurs when you create a new profile.
The GUID of the Offline Address Book could not be obtained on the client.
The name of the Offline Address Book was missing from the server. In this case, a full .oab file download is not expected to start or succeed, but it is logged anyway.
The GUID of the Offline Address Book was missing from the server. In this case, the full .oab file download is not expected to start or succeed, but it is logged anyway.
The server's Offline Address Book name and the client's Offline Address Book name are different.

The server's GUID and the client's GUID are different. This behavior can occur if the server had to regenerate a whole new Offline Address Book with the same name and then discarded the old set. Or, the client was moved between different forests.
The client's sequence number is bigger than the server.

You want detailed information in the Offline Address Book, but there is no detailed .oab file on your client. This behavior may occur if you manually force a download of the Offline Address Book, and then you click to clear the Download changes since last Send/Receive check box.
At least one .diff file was missing from the server.
The sum total of the .diff files to download may not be greater than 1/8 of the full .oab file for OAB version 3 or 1/2 for OAB version 4
You have the 'Allow SRS Full OAB Download' registry key set to 1, and your Send/Receive setting was set to always do a full download.

You do not have the locale of the Offline Address Book installed on your system, and you did a manual full .oab file download. Typically, Outlook updates the address book either once a month, when a conditions hits for such users, or when you download manually. Outlook uses these three methods to update the address book to avoid a condition that would cause a full download every day.
Applying the .diff file to the .oab file failed for some reason. Sometimes, Event #4 is triggered in this situation.

Rule.Name: sEnableIndexingDelegateMailboxes
Rule.Title: EnableIndexingDelegateMailboxes=1
Rule.Text: If you have a shared Exchange mailbox in your profile, you may see performance issues as the folders in this shared mailbox are being indexed. More information: http://blogs.technet.com/mikelag/archive/2009/05/04/windows-desktop-search-and-the-implications-on-wan-performance.aspx

Rule.Name: sPreventIndexingOutlook
Rule.Title: Indexing has been disabled using a policy setting in the registry
Rule.Text: Indexing for Windows Desktop Search has been disabled in the registry. Consequently, searching for items in Outlook will take longer.

Rule.Name: sPreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders
Rule.Title: PreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders=0 in the registry
Rule.Text: The PreventIndexingUncachedExchangeFolders value is set to 0 in the registry. This configuration can cause performance issues with an Online mode profile.

Rule.Name: sWSearchDesktopInteract
Rule.Title: Windows Search Service has "Allow service to interact with Desktop" enabled
Rule.Text: If the Windows Search Service has the "Allow service to interact with Desktop" setting enabled, you may not see any search results in Outlook.

Rule.Name: iFilterDllPathTest
Rule.Text: Path ={0}

Rule.Name: iFilterCompanyName
Rule.Text: Company Name ={0}

Rule.Name: iFilterDllPathTestWow
Rule.Text: Path (from \Wow6432Node registry data) ={0}

Rule.Name: iFilterCompanyNameWow
Rule.Text: Company Name ={0}

Object.Name: Application Event Log entries for Search

Rule.Name: sPDFIndexingIssue10023_24
Rule.Title: Possible Outlook search or indexing issue (event 10023 or 10024)
Rule.Text: The PDF iFilter is registered and Event 10023 or 10024 was found in the Application Event log. This has been known to cause indexing issues in Outlook. Click the 'Click here...' link below if you are unable to search for Outlook items or your indexing of Outlook items does not finish.

Rule.Name: sPDFIndexingIssue10023_24Wow
Rule.Title: Possible Outlook search or indexing issue (event 10023 or 10024)
Rule.Text: The PDF iFilter is registered (under \Wow6432Node) and Event 10023 or 10024 was found in the Application Event log. This has been known to cause indexing issues in Outlook. Click the 'Click here...' link below if you are unable to search for Outlook items or your indexing of Outlook items does not finish.

Rule.Name: sMissingMAPIProtocolHandler
Rule.Title: Outlook search may not be functioning properly because Mapiph.dll is missing.
Rule.Text: Your Outlook search results may be incomplete because the file Mapiph.dll is missing from your Office installation.

Rule.Name: sESM
Rule.Title: Exchange System Manager is installed
Rule.Text: No results are returned when you search for e-mail items using Instant Search.

Rule.Name: sStartSearchComm
Rule.Title: Search from the Windows Start menu will not locate email messages
Rule.Text: Start_SearchComm=0 in the registry. In this configuration, you will not be able to search for email messages using the Windows Search feature. However, you will be able to search for email messages from within Outlook.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start with an error indicating it 'needs to close'
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook the program does not successfully start. Instead, an error is displayed indicating 'Outlook has encountered a problem and needs to close'. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for another version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags15C2RWin8
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start with an error indicating it 'needs to close' and a prompt to 'Repair Now'
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook 2013 the program does not successfully start. Instead, an error is displayed indicating 'Outlook will need to be closed...' and there is a 'Repair Now' button in the error dialog. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for an earlier version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags15MSIWin8
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start and a 'Configuration Progress' dialog box is displayed
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook 2013 the program does not successfully start. Instead, a 'Configuration Progress' dialog box is displayed. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for an earlier version of Windows.

Rule.Name: sAppCompatFlags15C2RMSIWin7
Rule.Title: Outlook will not start and you see an error indicating 'You need to create a Microsoft Outlook profile'
Rule.Text: When you start Outlook 2013 the program does not successfully start. Instead, an error is displayed indicating 'You need to create a Microsoft Outlook profile' followed by another error indicating 'Cannot open the Outlook window'. This problem occurs when Outlook is configured to run in Compatibility mode for an earlier version of Windows.

Rule.Name: missingOlAppPath
Rule.Title: OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing
Rule.Text: The OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\OUTLOOK.EXE. Please run a repair of Office/Outlook.

Rule.Name: missingOlAppPathWow
Rule.Title: OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing
Rule.Text: The OUTLOOK.EXE registry key is missing in HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\OUTLOOK.EXE. Please run a repair of Office/Outlook.

Rule.Name: sBCMVersion2013
Rule.Text: {0} translates to either 'BCM 2013' or 'BCM 2010 + update to work with Outlook 2013'

Rule.Name: sBCMVersion2010
Rule.Text: {0} translates to 'BCM 2010'

Rule.Name: sBCMNotInstalled
Rule.Text: Business Contact Manager is not installed

Rule.Name: sBCM2013AddinNotLoaded
Rule.Text:
The add-in for BCM 2013 is not loaded because the LoadBehavior value is not 3 under the following registry key.
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\Microsoft.BusinessSolutions.eCRM.OutlookAddin.NativeConnect.5
Therefore, you will not have BCM functionality.

Rule.Name: sBCM2010AddinNotLoaded
Rule.Text:
The add-in for BCM 2010 is not loaded because the LoadBehavior value is not 3 under the following registry key.
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\Microsoft.BusinessSolutions.eCRM.OutlookAddin.NativeConnect.4
Therefore, you will not have BCM functionality because the add-in for BCM 2010 is not loaded.

Rule.Name: sWindowsFirewallStatus
Rule.P0: if(not($MachineDetails_fWindowsFirewallServiceNotRunning),'Windows Firewall service is not running','Windows Firewall service is running')

Rule.Name: sBITSInfo
Rule.Query: not($sEnableBITSMaxBandwidth='not set') or not($sMaxTransferRateOnSchedule='not set') or not($sMaxTransferRateOffSchedule='not set') or not($sUseSystemMaximum='not set') or not($sMaxBandwidthValidFrom='not set') or not($sMaxBandwidthValidTo='not set')
Rule.Title: BITS Policy Settings

Rule.Name: sBITSServiceDisabled
Rule.Title: BITS service is either stopped or disabled
Rule.Text: The Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is either stopped or disabled and your Offline Address Book may be out of date.

Rule.Name: sCDOInstalled
Rule.Title: Collaboration Data Objects (CDO) 1.2.1 is installed
Rule.Text: Collaboration Data Objects (CDO) 1.2.1 is not supported on a client with Outlook 2010 installed.

Rule.Name: sRSACertLengthRequireLT1024
Rule.Title: RSA certificate length requirement not set to default value (1024)
Rule.Text: Registry data was found on the client that modifies the default RSA certificate length requirement. Microsoft does not recommend customers use certificates less than 1024 bits long. The registry data should only be used as a temporary workaround.

Rule.Name: sBadDCOMValues
Rule.Title: Machine configuration settings may prevent opening Office document attachments
Rule.Text: The DCOM settings on this computer may cause you to receive errors when you open Office documents from email attachments. If you are unable to open email attachments, click the FixIt link below to reconfigure your machine settings.

Rule.Name: sDefaultMailClient
Rule.Title: No email messages are sent from Outlook when completing a mail merge using the HTML e-mail format
Rule.Text: When you perform a mail merge from Microsoft Word, no email messages are sent from Microsoft Outlook when you use the HTML email message format for your mail merge. Click the 'Click here ...' link below for the resolution to this problem.

Rule.Name: sMismatchedMSIComponentID15
Rule.Title: Errors sending email from other programs or mail merge due to incorrect registry data
Rule.Text: The value of the MSIComponentID in the registry is not correct for Outlook 2013. This configuration can cause 'no default mail client' errors when you start Outlook, try to send email from other applications, or try mail merge from Word. Please repair your Office 2013 installation or click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on this issue.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIcon
Rule.Title: Presence icons are hidden.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface because TurnOffPresenceIcon > 0 under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\IM. To display presence icons again, change the value of TurnOffPresenceIcon to 0.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIntegration
Rule.Title: Presence integration is disabled
Rule.Text: Presence integration is disabled because TurnOffPresenceIntegration=1 under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\IM. To display presence information again, change the value of TurnOffPresenceIntegration to 0.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIconPol
Rule.Title: Presence icons are hidden.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface because TurnOffPresenceIcon > 0 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\IM. To display presence icons again, please ask your administrator to remove the group policy setting for this feature.

Rule.Name: sTurnOffPresenceIntegrationPol
Rule.Title: Presence integration is disabled
Rule.Text: Presence integration is disabled because TurnOffPresenceIntegration=1 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\IM. To display presence information again, please ask your administrator to remove the group policy setting for this feature.

Rule.Name: sNoPresenceEnabled
Rule.Title: Presence icons are missing.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface because Enabled=0 under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\PersonaMenu. To display presence icons again, change the value of Enabled to 1.

Rule.Name: sNoPresenceEnabledPol
Rule.Title: Presence icons are missing.
Rule.Text: Presence icons are not displayed in the user interface because Enabled=0 under HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Office\%MAJORVERSION%.0\Common\PersonaMenu. To display presence icons again, please ask your administrator to remove the group policy setting for this feature.

Rule.Name: sNonMicrosoftDefaultIMProvider
Rule.Title: Non-Microsoft Instant Messaging client '{0}' is configured as the default IM provider
Rule.Text:
The '{0}' client is configured as the default Instant Messaging provider. This is not necessarily a problem configuration. But, if you are using a Microsoft IM client (Lync, Communicator or Skype) as your IM client you may need to modify the registry.
Click the 'Tell me more ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sBypassProxyForLocalAddresses
Rule.Text: Bypass proxy server for local address ={0}

Rule.Name: sWinHttpProxyServers
Rule.Title: Proxy server(s) found in the registry which may cause problems with Out of Office, Free/Busy, and MailTip features
Rule.Text: Proxy server(s) found in the registry in the WinHttpSettings binary value under 'HKLM\Software\%WOW6432NODE%\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\Connections'. If you are having problems with Out of Office (OOF), Free/busy (Availability) or MailTips in Outlook, please click the 'Click here ...' link below for additional information.

Object.Name: No proxy servers found in the WinHttpSettings binary value

Rule.Name: sWWLIBVersion
Rule.Title: WWLIB version = {0}
Rule.Text: This version of wwlib.dll can cause Outlook to crash when doing a mail merge if the message contains a Helvetica Type 1 font. If you experience this problem please install at least December 2010 Cumulative Update for Word 2010.

Rule.Name: sMAPI32Version
Rule.Title: Mail Merge doesn't work
Rule.Text: Mail merge in Microsoft Word does not work on a computer that is running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2.

Rule.Name: sBadMsoutlolb
Rule.Title: The file Msoutl.olb is not registered properly
Rule.Text: The file Msoutl.olb is not registered properly in the Windows Registry. In this situation, you may encounter problems performing a Mail Merge operation from Microsoft Word.

Rule.Name: sFileExtensionsWrongVersion
Rule.Query: $fSxS and ( ($fMsgUserChoiceProgID='not set' and $.!='Outlook.File.msg.15') or ($fMsgUserChoiceProgID!='not set' and $fMsgUserChoiceProgID!='Outlook.File.msg.15') )
Rule.Title: File extensions for Outlook are not associated with the latest installed Outlook version
Rule.Text: File extensions (like .msg) for Outlook are not associated with Outlook 2013. Therefore, if you double-click a .msg file it may open in an earlier version of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sBadApp
Rule.Title: 'No default mail client' errors sending files from Office programs
Rule.Text: A string value called 'Version' was found under the \MSMapiApps key in the registry. This configuration can cause errors when sending files from within Office programs. Click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on the resolution.

Rule.Name: sBadAppWow
Rule.Title: 'No default mail client' errors sending files from Office programs
Rule.Text: A string value called 'Version' was found under the \MSMapiApps key in the registry (under \Wow6432Node). This configuration can cause problems when sending files from within Office programs. Click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on the resolution.

Rule.Name: sUnicodeCharInProfileName
Rule.Title: Outlook may stop responding due to double-byte characters in the profile name ({0})
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding because Microsoft Lync incorrectly created profile information used by Outlook. This incorrect profile information is related to having extended characters in your Outlook profile name.

Rule.Name: sUnicodeCharInProfileName15
Rule.Title: Outlook may stop responding due to double-byte characters in the profile name ({0})
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding because Microsoft Lync incorrectly created profile information used by Outlook. This incorrect profile information is related to having extended characters in your Outlook profile name.

Rule.Name: sOldOLCWow
Rule.Title: Outlook Hotmail Connector is not up to date ({0})
Rule.Text: Please go to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=24677 to install the latest Outlook Hotmail Connector for 32-bit versions of Outlook

Rule.Name: sOldOLC32
Rule.Title: Outlook Hotmail Connector is not up to date ({0})
Rule.Text: Please go to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=24677 to install the latest Outlook Hotmail Connector for 32-bit versions of Outlook.

Rule.Name: sOldOLC64
Rule.Title: Outlook Hotmail Connector is not up to date ({0})
Rule.Text: Please go to http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=21305 to install the latest Outlook Hotmail Connector for 64-bit versions of Outlook 2010.

Rule.Name: Wd2007NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2007 is not installed
Rule.Text: You are using Outlook 2007 and Word 2007 is not installed. In this configuration, you will lose some functionality in Outlook and other Office programs. *Note* Updates for Word 2007 are still required as some Word 2007 files are installed by Office 2007.

Rule.Name: Wd2010NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2010 is not installed
Rule.Text: You are using Outlook 2010 and Word 2010 is not installed. In this configuration, you will lose some functionality in Outlook and other Office programs. *Note* Updates for Word 2010 are still required as some Word 2010 files are installed by Office 2010.

Rule.Name: Wd2013NotInstalled
Rule.Title: Microsoft Word 2013 is not installed
Rule.Text: You are using Outlook 2013 and Word 2013 is not installed. In this configuration, you will lose some functionality in Outlook and other Office programs. *Note* Updates for Word 2013 are still required as some Word 2013 files are installed by Office 2013.

Rule.Name: sWordPR
Rule.Title: The build number for winword.exe indicates a Private Release (PR) build
Rule.Text: The build number for winword.exe indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use.

Rule.Name: sZeroByteDefProfXML
Rule.Title: Zero byte profile.xml
Rule.Text: %DEFPROF%.xml is zero bytes. This can prevent Outlook from starting. To solve this problem, start Outlook with the /resetnavpane switch or install the June 2010 Cumulative Update for Outlook 2007.

Rule.Name: sTooManyShortcutsDefProf
Rule.Title: Large number of shortcuts detected: {0}
Rule.Text: Outlook may stop responding if you have 200 or more shortcuts in the Navigation Pane.

Rule.Name: sMissingVBAKey
Rule.Title: Registry data for Visual Basic for Applications is missing
Rule.Text: The registry is missing data for Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) in Office 2010. In this configuration, you may have some VBA functionality disabled.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2RWow
Rule.Query: $f2013C2R and ($fA32 or $fB32 or $fCWow or $fD32 or $fE32) and '%BIT%'!='%WBIT%'
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link below for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2R32
Rule.Query: $f2013C2R and ($fA32 or $fB32 or $fC or $fD32 or $fE32) and '%BIT%'='x86' and '%BIT%'='%WBIT%'
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link below for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2R64
Rule.Query: $f2013C2R and ($fA64 or $fB64 or $fC or $fD64 or $fE64) and '%BIT%'='x64'
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link below for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sMissingAppData
Rule.Title: AppData registry value is missing
Rule.Text: The AppData registry value is missing in HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\User Shell Folders. This prevents the user to connect or create a new profile.

Rule.Name: sUserShellFoldersCacheNotDefault
Rule.Query: ((versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.3')=0) and ($UserShellFoldersCache!=lower-case('%userprofile%\appdata\local\microsoft\windows\INetCache'))) or ((versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.0')>=0 and versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.3')<0) and ($UserShellFoldersCache!=lower-case('%userprofile%\appdata\local\microsoft\windows\temporary internet files'))) or ((versioncompare(substring($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,1,3),'6.0')<0) and ($UserShellFoldersCache!=lower-case('%userprofile%\local settings\temporary internet files')))
Rule.Title: The path for the Cache value under the \User Shell Folders key is not the default value
Rule.Text: When Outlook opens an email message containing an image, temporary files are written into the path specified by the Cache value in the registry. If this path is not the default setting, Outlook may be unable to render the image.

Rule.Name: sMSILoggingXP
Rule.Title: Windows Installer logging is enabled in the registry
Rule.Text: Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.

Rule.Name: sMSILogging
Rule.Title: Windows Installer logging is enabled in the registry
Rule.Text: Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.

Rule.Name: sZeroConfigExchange
Rule.Title: ZeroConfigExchange = 1
Rule.Text: If your mailbox is on an Exchange 2003 server, you may receive an error message if you create a new profile and the ZeroConfigExchange registry value is set to 1.

Rule.Name: sZeroConfigExchangeP
Rule.Title: ZeroConfigExchange = 1 Policy is set
Rule.Text: If your mailbox is on an Exchange 2003 server, you may receive an error message if you create a new profile and the ZeroConfigExchange policy is set to 1.
